emergencyRoomVisits.context: Of all users seeking emergency care

dosing.notes: Body weight does not significantly influence effects

pharmacokinetics.metabolism: Rapidly converted to psilocin in stomach

retrospectiveEvaluation.note: Consistent even among those with acute distress

setFactors.name: Expectations and Intentions
setFactors.description: Individual's mindset, goals, and expectations entering experience

components.name: Intentions
components.effect: Clear intentions associated with better outcomes

components.name: Expectations
components.effect: Unrealistic expectations can lead to disappointment or distress

setFactors.name: Psychological Flexibility and Surrender
setFactors.description: Ability to accept and surrender to experience
setFactors.oppositeEffect: Associated with difficult experiences and poor outcomes

riskFactors.name: Pre-existing cardiovascular conditions

substanceInteractions.mechanism: Increases blood pressure, heart rate, and body temperature

heartRate.tachycardia: Heart rate >100 bpm in 7% of administrations

substanceInteractions.mechanism: Transient increases in BP and HR, sympathomimetic effects
substanceInteractions.additionalConsiderations: Exacerbated by hot environments and physical exertion

riskFactors.clinicalSignificance: May increase risk of acute cardiovascular events
monitoringRecommendations: Continuous vital sign monitoring during session

riskFactors.name: Unprocessed Trauma History
riskFactors.description: History of traumatic experiences, especially if unresolved

nuancedConsiderations.therapeuticPotential: May be beneficial with proper support

preparationConsiderations: Trauma processing work prior to session

riskFactors.name: Concurrent Polydrug Use
riskFactors.description: Use of multiple substances simultaneously or in close temporal proximity

inDeaths.context: Most common theme in psychedelic-related deaths

specificCombinations.effect: Variable - may reduce or exacerbate difficulty

riskFactors.name: Adolescence and Young Adulthood
riskFactors.description: Younger age associated with increased vulnerability

substanceInteractions.mechanism: Developing brain more susceptible to disruption

negativeEffects.context: Of those with negative effects were under 25

riskFactors.name: Genetic Metabolic Variations
riskFactors.description: Individual genetic variations in drug metabolism

variants.effect: Higher plasma concentrations, increased risk of toxicity
Lower plasma concentrations, potentially reduced effects

riskFactors.clinicalImplications: May require dose adjustment or additional monitoring
riskFactors.futureDirections: Pharmacogenetic screening may become standard practice

riskFactors.name: Sex and Gender Differences
riskFactors.description: Biological sex and gender-related risk factors

hyponatremiaRisk.mechanism: Lower BMI associated with higher risk
hyponatremiaRisk.prevalence: Lower BMI individuals at higher risk

female.comedownEffects: More adverse mood effects than men

recommendations: Additional monitoring for women using MDMA
Trauma-informed approaches for women with assault history

subtypes.emergingEvidence: Recent research shows safety in controlled settings

emergingEvidence.study: Bipolar II treatment-resistant depression with psilocybin
emergingEvidence.finding: No increases in mania or hypomania
emergingEvidence.implication: May be safe for this specific population with proper protocols

substanceRisks.screening: Essential - requires careful screening, preparation, and support

prevalence.note: Varies by diagnostic criteria and population

medicalConditions.name: Personality Disorders
medicalConditions.description: Cluster of personality disorders including borderline, antisocial, etc.

adverseEvents.name: Acute Anxiety
adverseEvents.description: Anxiety experienced during or shortly after psychedelic administration

temporalPattern.persistence: May last hours beyond peak effects in some cases

prevalence.context: First-time users experienced some level of fear

prevalence.timing: Particularly prior to and during onset (first 10-15 minutes)

associatedWithWorseningInLongTerm.context: Among those with negative psychological responses

adverseEvents.clinicalSignificance: Usually transient but can escalate without proper support

adverseEvents.name: Hallucinogen Persisting Perception Disorder (HPPD)
adverseEvents.description: Persistent perceptual disturbances long after drug effects have worn off

reported.context: Visual disturbances without further drug use
Long-term perceptual changes when asked directly

onsetPattern.timing: Can occur immediately or develop gradually

clinicalTrialsData.contemporary: No cases reported in contemporary clinical trials

adverseEvents.name: Serotonin Syndrome
adverseEvents.description: Potentially life-threatening condition from excessive serotonin

substanceOccurrence.prevalence: Rare in clinical settings; more common with polydrug use
substanceOccurrence.mechanism: Excessive serotonin release and reuptake inhibition

adverseEvents.name: Hyponatremia
adverseEvents.description: Abnormally low sodium levels in blood

clinical.context: Controlled study with unrestricted fluid intake

mechanism: Physical exertion with hypotonic fluid replacement

therapeuticAlliance.name: Therapeutic Alliance Quality
therapeuticAlliance.description: Quality of relationship between therapist/facilitator and participant

components.description: Participant feels physically and emotionally safe
Confidence in facilitator's competence and intentions
Facilitator's ability to understand participant's experience

interventions: Multiple preparation sessions to build rapport

evidenceForImportance.finding: Strong alliance associated with better outcomes
Weak alliance associated with poorer outcomes
Rapport mediates emotional breakthrough and mystical experiences

boundaryViolations.name: Sexual Misconduct
boundaryViolations.description: Sexual touching, contact, or exploitation during psychedelic therapy

prevalenceData.context: Of sexual misconduct perpetrators were underground sitters/guides
Participants knowing someone who experienced sexual violations

boundaryViolations.name: Financial Exploitation
boundaryViolations.description: Taking financial advantage of vulnerable clients

boundaryViolations.name: Emotional Manipulation/Abuse
boundaryViolations.description: Using power imbalance to manipulate or emotionally abuse clients

boundaryViolations.name: Epistemic Harm/Belief Imposition
boundaryViolations.description: Imposing beliefs or interpretations onto participants

details: What to expect if things get difficult

preparationPractices.name: Intention Setting
preparationPractices.description: Process of defining clear intentions and goals for the experience

preparationPractices.name: Life Review
preparationPractices.description: Comprehensive review of participant's life history

skills.description: Deep breathing exercises for anxiety management
skills.practice: Taught and practiced in preparation sessions

skills.description: Methods to stay connected to present moment
Letting go and accepting the experience

integrationPractices.name: Somatic Practices
integrationPractices.specialRelevance: Especially important for trauma processing and ayahuasca

changes.motivations: Insights about life purpose and values

groupDynamicsFactors.name: Pre-existing Relationship Tensions
groupDynamicsFactors.description: Using psychedelics with people with whom there are unresolved conflicts

prevalence.context: Of those with negative experiences took psychedelics with someone they had relationship issues with

nuance.intentional: Some people intentionally use psychedelics to work through relationship issues

recommendations: Avoid using with people you have active conflicts with
If working on relationships, do so with professional facilitation

groupDynamicsFactors.name: Group Composition and Power Dynamics
groupDynamicsFactors.description: The makeup of the group and power relationships within it

considerations: Larger groups may be harder to manage

groupDynamicsFactors.name: Collective Suggestibility and Belief Shaping
groupDynamicsFactors.description: Heightened suggestibility in group settings during psychedelic states
groupDynamicsFactors.mechanism: Psychedelics increase suggestibility, amplified in group contexts
groupDynamicsFactors.bidirectional: Can lead to healthy or unhealthy outcomes

groupDynamicsFactors.name: Emotional Contagion
groupDynamicsFactors.description: Spread of emotional states within group
groupDynamicsFactors.mechanism: Intense emotions during psychedelic states can spread between participants
prevention: Trained facilitators who can isolate distressed participants

groupDynamicsFactors.name: Group Cohesion Effects
groupDynamicsFactors.description: Strong bonding that can occur through shared psychedelic experiences

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Cultural Context and Understanding
culturalSpiritualFactors.description: Alignment or misalignment between psychedelic experience and cultural framework

risks.description: Interpreting experiences through inappropriate cultural lens
Experiencing effects without cultural framework to make sense of them
Western adoption of Indigenous practices without respect or understanding

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Culturally Competent Care
culturalSpiritualFactors.description: Providing care that respects and responds to cultural backgrounds

lackOfImpact.description: Lack of culturally competent care can lead to poor outcomes

recommendations: Include diverse perspectives in treatment development

culturalSpiritualFactors.name: Spiritual Struggles and Crises
riskFactors: Dismissal of spiritual experiences by facilitators
consequences: Potential for growth if properly supported

legalSocioeconomicFactors.name: Prohibition and Illegal Status
legalSocioeconomicFactors.description: Harms arising from criminalization of psychedelics

impacts.description: Absence of regulation leads to variable purity and unknown adulterants
Fear of legal repercussions prevents help-seeking
Racialized drug policies lead to disproportionate arrests

legalSocioeconomicFactors.name: Socioeconomic Barriers to Access
legalSocioeconomicFactors.description: Financial and resource barriers limiting access to safe use

barriers.description: Psychedelic therapy can cost $25,000+ per course
Most psychedelic therapies not covered by insurance
Services concentrated in urban, wealthy areas
barriers.impact: Rural and underserved areas lack access
Difficult for those without vehicles or access to transit

barriers.description: Sessions and integration require time away from employment
barriers.impact: Those with inflexible jobs or hourly wages cannot participate

consequences: Wealthy get therapeutic access; poor relegated to unregulated market
Higher rates of unsafe use in lower SES populations

legalSocioeconomicFactors.name: Economic Stress and Unsafe Use Patterns
legalSocioeconomicFactors.description: How poverty and economic stress increase risks

mechanisms.description: Using psychedelics to cope with untreated mental health issues
mechanisms.reason: Lack of affordable mental health care

mechanisms.description: Use in uncontrolled environments without support
Poverty, unstable housing, income inequality linked to mental health disorders

overdoseData.finding: Overdose death rates highest in counties with highest income inequality

legalSocioeconomicFactors.name: Limited Healthcare Access
legalSocioeconomicFactors.description: Inability to access medical and mental health services for adverse events

needingProfessionalHelp.context: Of non-clinical psychedelic users require medical/psychiatric assistance

legalSocioeconomicFactors.populations: Particularly affects uninsured, underinsured, rural populations

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Adulteration with Novel Psychoactive Substances
contaminationQualityFactors.description: Presence of substances other than the purported psychedelic

prevalenceExamples.purity: 63% contained MDMA or analog; 29% contained other identifiable drugs

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Purity and Potency Variability

substanceExamples.variability: Significant between species, growing conditions, storage
Hot spots and cold spots within same batch
Increasing average content (2-3x typical dose common)
Range from 8.2% to 32.9% purity in extracts; 61.5% to 73.4% in hydrochloride

harmReduction: Use standardized pharmaceutical-grade substances when possible

contaminationQualityFactors.name: Storage and Degradation
contaminationQualityFactors.description: Loss of potency over time due to improper storage

substanceExamples.comparison: Fresh mushrooms degrade faster than dried

prevention: Be aware of age of substances

substanceExamples.consequence: Severe illness or death from toxic mushrooms

substanceExamples.risk: Using wrong plant species in brew

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Non-Pharmacological Interventions

interventions.description: Maintain observation and regular verbal contact
Remind that experience is temporary, drug-related, and they are safe
Help participant focus on present moment and physical sensations

emergencyResponseProtocols.effectiveness: High - manages most cases of distress

cautions: Haloperidol may exacerbate psychosis-like symptoms - avoid

medications.evidence: Shows promise in attenuating psilocybin effects

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Emergency Medical Services
whenToCall: Condition does not improve with interventions
Severe physiological symptoms (chest pain, seizure, hyperthermia)
emergencyResponseProtocols.prevention: Proper screening and preparation reduce need for EMS

firstTimeLSD.context: Seeking serious adverse events requiring EMT

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Psychedelic Crisis Helplines
emergencyResponseProtocols.description: Professional peer support via telephone for acute crises
emergencyResponseProtocols.impact: Can prevent escalation and reduce burden on emergency services

assessmentTools.name: Dysfunctional Attitude Scale
assessmentTools.note: Those with higher scores may have more difficult experiences

doseResponseCurves.interpretation: Higher doses associated with increased prevalence of adverse effects
Clear dose-response relationship for mystical experiences

complexInteractions.specificOutcome: Increased risk of manic episode in uncontrolled setting

mechanism: Higher plasma MDMA in females with low BMI
Dancing increases water loss and hypotonic replacement

complexInteractions.mechanism: MAOIs increase 5-MeO-DMT exposure up to sixfold

metadata.geographicScope: Global with emphasis on North America and Europe
metadata.qualityAssessment: Comprehensive but varies by substance and outcome
knownLimitations: Small sample sizes for many substances
